评论详情: I got this for my daughter for Halloween. It came just in time and was perfect for what she was being! It looks nice for the price.

We bought this for a WWII reenactment weekend and my daughter got so many compliments on it. It was true to size and comfy. The material is thin and feels like polyester (it might be), but we didn’t want to spend a fortune for one night and this fit the bill.
I got many compliments wearing this dress for a 20's themed party

I really like this dress. It's thin and light but has the texture of a Halloween costume. It feels like this dress will fall apart if I'm too rough for it. I got it to dress as Alice from Alice in Wonderland and the color is pretty but if you're not an hourglass body type this dress may be very squared in the chest area. I don't think this dress is worth this price. I'd expect something like this to be in the $15-$20 range. If you're willing to make some sacrifices to buy a cheaper dress, this would be alright but there are certainly dresses that fit better. Wearing a petticoat with it is almost essential to get the shape to really show. But boxy in the chest area and I'd say it runs true to size (I'm 145 lbs and 5'3") it's a good dress if you don't plan to wear it often.
Very nice fit and comfortable material. Going to 40s tea party and this worked great and I can wear it again and again.
Pretty dress but I couldn't figure out how to tie the bow.. 😂
Premium like fabric, well made and true to size

I didn't realize this was going to be so small. I just got another 1950's dress in this size, a different one, that fit ok. This one is too small in the shoulders and it's too tight around my torso. The waist on it is a mile above my actual waist. The length of it is basically a miniskirt. I am middle aged, too old for such a short dress. This dress makes me look like I'm off my rocker hahaha. I'm giving it 2 stars because I might wear it someday. Also it probably won't be so short on normal size ladies who are reading this. (I'm 6 ft tall and this is a 2X.) It's also very scratchy and uncomfortable polyester. I would return it but that's such a pita. Update: Changed it to 1 star when my partner saw it tonight. He said *Absolutely Not, it's WAY Too Small.* He was shocked. He's going to return it for me. I guess I won't be dressing like a looney tunes after all.

评论概述: Great fit, quality matches the price
评论详情: The fit is perfect. I think the high waist is perfect for a petticoat and also flattering for  fuller body types. The material is thinner and kind of sheer if wearing the wrong undergarments. There was thread snapping sounds when I put it on for the first time, but for the price it isn’t meant to hold up for more than a few wears. The buttons aren’t sewn on great and will probably need reinforcing, especially if you are busty like me.

I have a long torso.  Consider that when ordering.  I am 5’7” and ordered a large.  Would’ve preferred the dress waistband to sit a bit lower.  I liked the dress even still.  It’s lightweight and quite comfortable.

评论概述: 1940s Dress looks just like the picture!
评论详情: Ordered a size Medium (wear size 8 or 10 dress) to be worn in a stage production for the 1940s. Dress was light-weight, easy on and off, well constructed, unlined...yet not see through, and loved the two color combination.

The recommended size for me was a large. The measurement guide indicated the same. However, it was FAR too small. I'm not a tiny person but my measurement ratios (should to waist, waist to knee, etc)  are in line with a standard mannequin. The waist was too high for this period of dress and the length too short. It's just a polyester dress - rather cheap - but I expected that for the cost. If you look closely at the models in the advertising the waist is too high for them too. It's almost empire. If you have a bust at ALL you may find this dress difficult to button. The proportions seemed more appropriate for a junior size. If you are petite, this may well work very well for you. I lived in Japan for 3 years and this felt like a "Japanese" large. I couldn't buy clothes over there. This could work well for a 1940's themed party or swing dancing. I gave it 4 stars because of the waist and length proportions. Doesn't seem fair to trash it completely because of the cheap fabric or the fit. I always expect inexpensive clothes to not fit well but it was cute enough that I was willing to give it a try. I can't upload a photo because you don't need to see me standing there in a dress above my knees with "the girls" fully exposed.
Very nice dress. Fit good.

The size of the dress fits me snuggly, except around the neck. It seems like a neck size for a much larger dress, so the bow hangs down. A bit unsightly and nothing I can do about it really, unless I removed the neck, shortened the strip and sewed it back in. Cute dress, and lots of compliments. It is a bit itchy though—rough polyester.
This dress looks very nice and fits well.

First off it is cute but it's Spirit Halloween costume material. The one I purchased was very smelly out of the package (chemical smell) did not try it on due to the smell and by the look of it, the skirt was unevenly cut out and not seamed. Very poor quality in my opinion.

I love the look of this dress. The dress fit everywhere except for the waist. It’s loose around my waist. It wasn’t noticeably too baggy around the waist but it wasn’t a perfect fit. It was also a bit scratchy but not too bad.

The top of this dress is stunning. From the shoulder details, to the attached neck tie and the covered buttons, it's so beautiful.  On the down-side, while the fabric was comfortable to wear and looks attractive,  it feels a little cheap to me.  I'm 5'6" and 130 lb wearing the size Large.  I sized-up on purpose as I like a loose-look, and I'm glad I did.  I think a Medium might actually have been a little tight.  Overall, the dress did NOT disappoint.
Very happy with my 40s costume dress
Love the dress! Purchased for a themed Christmas photo it turned out great. I sided up to an XL due to reviews as I am on the bustier side but I could have worn a large!
I got a large.  I'm 5'1. With crinoline underneath it still fit comfortably. Material light weight.  Looked great.  Assessories  bought separately.
